Day 5 of 12 Days of Giveaways!

Today I’m giving away 3 signed sets of my first duology, ALL THE STARS AND TEETH and ALL THE TIDES OF FATE! If you’re here because you know Belladonna, ATSAT is pretty different! It’s more of a high fantasy adventure, about a morally gray princess who has to team up with a pirate to save her kingdom from a dangerous new threat. There are 7 different forms of magic, sword fights, a giant nautical adventure, and a mermaid who may or may not like to eat people. It’s got a similar grim dark/somehow still bright vibe as Belladonna, but is more on the fantastical side. If that sounds up your alley, here are the details on how to enter:

🎁 Tag two friends who may be interested in a nautical adventure and winning this book. (If you win, they win too!)

Open US only. Winners will be selected on December 23rd.

The book is BELLADONNA by Adalyn Grace, and the “little bird” snippet is pulled directly from the audiobook 🥰 It’s a romantic murder mystery I pitch as a Victorian Bridgerton meets Knives Out

Today I’m in my feels because I’m outlining a new book that features a new couple’s love story, and while I fought so hard for this book and couldn’t be more excited for it, stepping away from Death and Signa feels so bizarre. I think they’re always going to have a very special place in my heart. Belladonna as a book is so incredibly special to me, and as we’re nearing the end of the year I just want to thank you all again for being so overwhelmingly supportive of it. I have waited a very long time to share this book, and I can’t wait to share its sequel, Foxglove, alongside a few more surprises with you all next year. I’ve now seen the almost final cases for the US edition, alongside the stunning UK cover, and we’re going to share both with you soon! 2023 is shaping up to be a big one, and I’m so excited!

#belladonnabook #yafantasy #yalit #yabooks #tbr #romancebooks #romantasy #fantasyromance #fantasybooks #bookstagram #booktok #bookreels #bookrecommendations

Today, I’m working on my dedication for Foxglove, which reminded me that I never shared the dedication for Belladonna. This book is dedicated to some of my favorite people in the world, and ones that really helped me to finally write it exactly the way I wanted. I always wanted Death as the love interest of the book, but for some reason it took me a long time to get up the nerve to just do it and make the book as weird and as darkly romantic as I wanted it to be. Trust me, I know that not every reader is going to be into the idea of a romance and steam with a literal shadow 🤣 but I’m really glad I leaned in, and for a car ride conversation that finally made me take the leap to make Death an official love interest. They also deserve points for putting up with me through debut year, lol

Hello, friends 💜

This year is only a few weeks in, and I’ve already got a slew of fun things happening! I’m a few weeks away from being completely done with Foxglove (minus a few checks for typos and things like that). This month, I’m going to officially begin writing my fifth (!) contracted book. This year I’m making a concentrated effort to feel more human and less like my job is everything. I decided that I wanted to start taking classes and joining groups, and meeting people who understand nothing about publishing. I’ve already started one class, and later this month I begin a few others! I kind of went a little overboard, though. . . I signed up for volleyball, tennis, badminton, yoga, and a few other continuous classes so far 😅 there was more that I wanted to do, like cooking and fencing and language classes, but had to hold myself back for now. There’s a reason I graduated from school a few years early—I’m greedy and want to take everything that sounds remotely interesting right at this possible second, and it’s so hard for me to choose what to do when. My plan is to try everything and see what I like! 

My hobby used to be writing, but for the past several years that’s been my job and I’m really beginning to feel the lack of something that is solely for fun. I’m very eager to see what sticks and what I enjoy! I’ve never even picked up a tennis racket in my life, so some of these are about to be interesting. 

As for next month . . . I’m going to be able to reveal something very beautiful to you all 🤭 more soooon!

#authorsofinstagram #authorlife #yafantasy #author

Starting a new book is always the hardest part for me. Breaking into a story, finding its voice, staring at the blank page…it always makes me feel like I’ve completely forgotten how to write. The words aren’t right, nothing feels grounded yet, and I constantly have to remind myself that this happens every time. First drafts are ugly, and hardly resemble their final forms. I know this, and yet every time I start a first draft, I panic anyway 🤣

But hey, at least I have a nice view while I work, and I can’t wait to share details about this new book soon!

𝙁𝙤𝙭𝙜𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 𝙎𝙪𝙢𝙢𝙖𝙧𝙮:
(Minor spoilers for the end of Belladonna!)

A duke has been murdered. The lord of Thorn Grove has been framed. And Fate, the elusive brother of Death, has taken up residence in a sumptuous estate nearby. He’s hellbent on revenge after Death took the life of the woman he loved many years ago...and now he’s determined to have Signa for himself, no matter the cost.

Signa and her cousin Blythe are certain that Fate can save Elijah Hawthorne from prison if they will entertain his presence. But the more time the girls spend with Fate, the more frightening their reality becomes as Signa exhibits dramatic new powers that link her to Fate’s past. With mysteries and danger around every corner, the cousins must decide if they can trust one another as they navigate their futures in high society, unravel the murders that haunt their family, and play Fate’s unexpected games—all with their destinies hanging in the balance.

Dangerous, suspenseful, and seductive, this sequel to Death and Signa’s story is as utterly romantic as it is perfectly deadly.

Today I’m working on Foxglove’s pass pages before diving into drafting my 5th book. Pass pages are the first time where you get to see the book laid out in the format it’s going to be printed. All the pages are designed, and it finally looks like a proper “book.” It’s the last chance to change things and find typos/correct sentences/etc before the book goes to print.

This book was an enormous challenge. There were times where I was not convinced I would ever finish it. I wrote dozens of thousands of words that had to change or be deleted. A POV that I cut entirely. As much as I knew what I wanted to have happen, it took a while for me to figure out how to actually tell that story. But now, as I near the end of reading Foxglove all the way through for what be the final time before publication, I am so happy with how the book ended up. I love these characters and this world so much, and I can’t wait to share more about it with you all very soon. We still have many secrets and surprises to share over the next few months, and I truly can’t wait to reveal everything 💜

#amwriting #authorsofig #writersofig #yafantasy #authorlife

I’m so pleased to be sharing the paperback cover reveal for the UK edition of BELLADONNA! 🥳 

Belladonna is a Gothic-infused romantic murder mystery about a 20 year old girl who can see spirits, and who has to team up with Death himself (the man she hates more than anyone or anything) to solve a murder in an eerie Victorian manor. It’s an enemies-to-lovers paranormal romance with Death as the love interest, and is full of masquerade balls, ghostly banter, and midnight horseback rides through the moors.

Unlike the pink hardcover, this paperback features a beautiful, rich purple background that looks just like a belladonna berry. It’ll be available on June 22nd, and is available for pre order now! You all have been asking (and asking, and asking…) and I can FINALLY answer! The Belladonna series is going to be a trilogy! 🥳🥳🥳

I can’t tell you anything else about Book 3 just yet, but I am so happy to finally get to announce this and even happier to get to write it.

Originally, I only Belladonna as a standalone to my publisher, which is why it’s taken me so long to answer the question of how many books this series will have because I had to convince them to buy more! You know that meme going around with Nicolas Cage and Pedro Pascal? I feel like my publisher is Nicolas Cage whenever they hear I want to write another book in the series and I am Pedro Pascal 🤣
I’ve known that I want to write this third book for a while, but it was only possible to convince my publisher to let me because of how much you all have showed up for this series. So thank you for letting me write this book, because I am wildly excited for it. It’s quite different than the rest of the books in the series, and has some of my favorite tropes to write. I can’t wait to talk about it more, and I’m the meantime… Here’s its title. I have been giving the same clue for weeks now, so I hope it finally makes sense🥀

Here she is!!! I swear, I have not been able to post on here for months without someone asking about the Fairyloot edition of Foxglove 😂 It’s been so hard to keep it a secret! Your excitement has made me so happy, and I’m thrilled to finally be able to share the details straight from @fairyloot’s page:

What is special about this Exclusive Edition?
✨ EXCLUSIVE COVER: Exclusive colourway change to the cover
✨ STENCIL SPRAYED EDGES: Two coloured stencil sprayed edges to compliment the cover
✨ ARTWORK PRINTED ONTO THE HARDCOVER by @taratjah
✨ ARTWORK ON THE ENDPAPERS by @monolimeart
✨ SIGNED BY THE AUTHOR: Each book will be signed by the author, Adalyn Grace

This is NOT part of @fairyloot’s normal monthly subscriptions and if you wish to order a book, they will be available in the Fairy Trove (they ship to many countries worldwide).

The ‘Foxglove’ Exclusive Edition will be available for £22 GBP / $30 USD + shipping and is expected to ship around October/November.

On August 16th at 12pm BST, Fairyloot will send out a private Early Access link to everyone who received the September ‘Farewell My Love’ 2022 YA box. They will then send out an Early Access email to all UK/INT active subscribers at 2pm BST, and all US/Canada active subscribers at 4pm BST. If they have any stock remaining, these will be available in the Fairy Trove to the general public on August 17th at 1pm BST for UK/INT customers and 4pm BST for US/Canada customers.

I have seen all the art that’s in this edition of the book, and let me just say that it’s STUNNING. I am so excited to hold it in my hands, and I hope that you all love it as much as I do! 🧚‍♀️✨

It’s here! The Belladonna merch shop is officially open, and I’ve had way too much fun decking myself out with shirts, totes, stickers, mugs, and the most comfortable crew neck I’ve ever worn in my life. Here are pictures of just a few of the designs available!

You can find the shop linked on my profile, though I wanted to tell you all a few details first:

With every book launch, I plan to add additional (and usually book specific) designs. Some of them will be limited release. For example, the first limited release I plan to do is an alternate dust jacket for Belladonna that we’ll be taking pre orders for in a few weeks. I also plan to release some seasonal designs, and continue to add to the shop throughout the years.

Currently there is only merch for Belladonna. However, I do plan to add a few pieces for my first series, ALL THE STARS AND TEETH, soon. I also will be adding FOXGLOVE pieces later this year.

I hope that you all enjoy what’s currently available! Thank you for all the messages pushing me to get this set up; I’m very excited for the first time I get to see someone with Belladonna bookish merch! 🤣

I’ve been asked by quite a few of you about this, so I’m happy to finally have official wording from my UK publisher on the pre ordered first edition foiled editions of Foxglove. Basically, if you pre ordered you should have received this edition. Long story short, there were not enough copies printed to cover those pre orders. I’m not sure how it happened, but I’m working to ensure that nothing like this happens again in the future. I apologize to all the readers who ordered something they did not receive, and want to make sure that gets fixed. Here’s Hodder’s official message on how you can get the corrected edition:

“Our first edition printing of FOXGLOVE all contained foil, however due to overwhelming and exciting demand we had to print again before publication, and that edition did not have the foil.

We understand that some readers might be disappointed and that our messaging wasn’t entirely clear, so in light of that we will be printing again WITH foil. Anyone who can provide proof of their pre-order purchase, along with a photo of the copyright page of their edition, and was disappointed to have received a copy without foil should email hodderscape@hodder.co.uk, and we will supply a new copy WITH foil. This offer will be open until the end of September 2023.

We cannot guarantee whether there will be foil or un-foiled copies available online, but as we are printing extras, do pop in to your local bookstores and check beneath the jackets for your chance to snag a special foiled copy as long as stocks last!”

I am very glad that I didn’t wear mascara today.

Thank you all so, so much. The release and excitement for this book has been unlike anything I’ve ever experienced, and I’m still trying to process it. Thank you for every message, for every read, for the art, the cosplay, every pre order, and just everything. As an author you always hope that your book will find its readers, and I’m so unbelievably happy that it has found it’s way to all of you. I had a nice happy cry in the corner of the airport when I got the news.

This achievement wouldn’t have been possible without every single person at @thenovl who has had a hand in bringing this book into the world (especially my amazing editor @deirdreejones and publicist @clew570 who have been fielding so many questions and emails and are just the very best at what they do), as well as the best agent in the industry, @petejknapp, and the incredible team at @parkandfine. I am very lucky to work with this incredible team, and to get to share this book with the most amazing readers. You all are just the best 🥹

You have now officially made this series a #1 New York Times, Wall Street Journal, IndieBound, and USA Today bestseller 💜 thank you all so so much.

BELLADONNA and FOXGLOVE are available now, with beautiful limited editions while supplies last for the first printings only. I pitch the series as a Gothic-infused romantic mystery about a girl who must team up with Death himself to solve a mystery, and may or may not end up catching feelings for him along the way. I pitch the series as a Gothic Bridgerton meets Crimson Peak!

I can’t believe it’s been nearly two weeks since FOXGLOVE released into the world! Thank you for keeping this book in the top 10 at Barnes & Noble since release, for the messages, stunning fan art that I am dying to share, and just for every bit of your support in general. It’s been an amazing journey, and I can’t wait to share the final piece of the story with you. With that said . . .  I’d suggest reading Foxglove by mid October 👀

#foxglovebook #bookstagram #booktok #barnesandnoble #yafantasy #tbr #iwriteya #fantasybooks #romantasy #fantasyromance #books #readersofinstagram #belladonnabook

Minus the mustache, though… The books are BELLADONNA and FOXGLOVE by Adalyn Grace. The clips are from Anna Karenina.

I hope that Fate is growing on you the same way that he grew on me while I was writing him 😌 Fate, AKA Prince Aris Dryden, is a strutting peacock who has never met a grudge he can’t hold on to for literal centuries. Where I pitch Belladonna as a Gothic Bridgerton meet Knives Out, Foxglove sprinkles in a heavy helping of The Vampire Diaries-styles immortal sibling rivalry between Death and Fate.

I’ve been back from tour for two weeks now and have finally been able to sort through so many fun photos and look back on what an amazing time it was! I’ve been healing up from being super sick, so forgive my many many delayed thanks to every person who came out to support me and Foxglove on what was my most fun tour to date! I had a blast meeting all of you and reading all of your notes in my tour copy 💜

In just a few short days I’m jetting off out of the country for the very first time ever on a European tour that I could not be more thrilled about. I’m so excited to get to travel with my partner and my closet friends and to meet all of you in London, Scotland, Madrid, and France! The fact that I’m leaving in five days hasn’t quite hit me yet, and I don’t think I’ll really believe it until I’m there! With the exception of the events in France that are not ticketed, all events are sold out. But I’ll be signing some extra stock around the cities so stay tuned!

I cannot WAIT to see you and to be in Europe! 🤭 sound off below if you’re coming to any of the events!!

Today’s the day! After an incredible 3.5 weeks traveling across Europe and meeting so many incredible readers and several of my wonderful overseas publishers, I’m finally headed back to the states to hunker down and get serious about edits for Wisteria.

I got to join @stephanie_garber and several wonderful people in the book community for the most delicious high tea I’ve ever had. Fairyloot has done more for my visibility in the UK than anyone or anything, and I’m eternally grateful for them for getting this series into the hands of so many new readers. Thank you, thank you to Fairyloot 🧚 and thank you so much to everyone who joined us 🫖

What a way to cap off the most incredible trip! Cheers, London! You were fabulous and I can’t wait to come back very soon.

I can’t believe I finally get to share the stunning US covers of WISTERIA with you, as well as the book’s first chapter! It feels like I was just sharing Belladonna’s cover yesterday, and yet here we are preparing for the finale 🥹

On the left is the standard US cover (blue) and the @barnesandnoble exclusive on the right (white)! As with the rest of the series, please note that the B&N exclusive is a limited edition. Both books will have a gorgeous unique case for the first edition, which will designed to match the rest of the series. We’ll be revealing those soon! The designed cases and exclusive editions will be 𝗹𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗼𝗼𝗸’𝘀 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝘆, so if there’s one you’re absolutely certain you want, 𝙄 𝙝𝙞𝙜𝙝𝙡𝙮 𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙙 𝙥𝙧𝙚 𝙤𝙧𝙙𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜! We’ve sold out of some editions pretty quickly.
 
Signed & personalized copies of the blue edition will be available through @mystgalaxybooks, and will come with an art print and enamel pin (to be revealed). 
The B&N edition will come with bonus content in the book itself!

These beautiful covers were illustrated by @elena.masci_illustrations and designed by @jennykimuradesign —the same amazingly talented duo who gave this series a face. Literally! Thank you both so so much.

The news is out! For the first time ever, this special edition of FOXGLOVE is available signed through @barnesandnoble’s Black Friday Signed Books sale (in stores only)! We’ve never done signed copies for these editions before, and they’re available while supplies last with this gorgeous limited edition hardcover case. It’s like a Gothic Bridgerton, but add a Who Dun In mystery. There’s Christmas masquerades, eerie manors, and a whole lot of romance and banter.

[PRÉCOMMANDES] ”Foxglove”, deuxième tome d’une trilogie écrite par Adalyn Grace, sera à retrouver en librairie le 4 janvier prochain ! 🖤☠️

Préparez-vous à retrouver Signa dans un univers fantasy gothique sur fond d’herbologie vénéneuse, de jardins hantés et de magie de faucheurs ! Cette romance ennemies to lovers reviendra pour votre plus grand plaisir, mais aussi le nôtre, avec un nouveau meurtre à résoudre et de nombreux rebondissements. 😍

Voici les ISBN : 

Relié collector : 9782378764050
Broché : 9782378764043

Résumé du deuxième tome (attentions aux spoilers) : 👇🏻

On dit que la queue-de-loup est plus mortelle encore juste avant que ses fleurs n’éclosent.

Elijah Hawthorne est accusé du meurtre de Lord Wakefield. Signa et Bliss assistent impuissantes à son emprisonnement, persuadées de son innocence. Pour Signa, le seul qui puisse sauver son oncle est le Destin. Cependant, ce dernier n’a qu’un but : se venger de l’ange de la Mort en lui prenant son grand amour, Signa.   Malgré les avertissements de l’ange de la Mort, la jeune femme décide de conclure un marché avec le Destin. À ses côtés, Signa commence à manifester de nouveaux pouvoirs qui la lient directement au passé de l’immortel. Sa vie à l’Épineuse pourrait basculer tandis que Bliss nourrit des soupçons à son encontre. Piégées dans les fils du Destin, les deux cousines pourront-elles se faire confiance ?

Traduit par Hélène Bury, retrouvez “Foxglove”, la suite de “Belladonna” d’Adalyn Grace, le 4 janvier 2024 en librairie en relié collector, broché et e-book ! 🔥

May-July’s memories!

Going back through all these photos has me realizing just how obsessed @timesnewrachel and I are with each other. She’s in every single one of my monthly memory groupings 🤣

These months were pretty quiet! I played a lot of badminton, was finishing up the first draft of Wisteria (virtually alongside Rachel, as evidence by the last photo), and loafed around the house with the dogs. 

I also headed over to San Diego Comic Con in my hometown, which was an interesting experience because of the Hollywood strikes that shut so much of it down and made walking through the exhibit hall take a million years. I also gave out two of four bound manuscripts I gave out for Foxglove! I had people try to find me in the disastrous exhibit hall and answer a question (it was about Pokémon, which I gave a clue about with my Ghastly earrings 😌). I was surprised that people actually managed to hunt me down so quickly, and the whole day was a great memory.

Other than that I opened up my merch shop, finished signing tip-ins for Foxglove (all of mine are handsigned, friends. I get asked about this a lot and as of right now I have no digitally signed books out in the world), and apparently just hung out with Rachel 🤷🏻‍♀️

I am truly obsessed with this stunning and absolutely magical artwork of Death and Signa from my book series Belladonna, illustrated by the incredibly talented @hachandraws 

Their work is soft and magical and buttery and I just love it so so so much 😍 if you don’t follow them yet, you absolutely should 

I’m quieter on here as I’m turtled up for the winter, working on finishing up Wisteria while simultaneously building out the world and characters of my next project. I’ve been back and forth on different ideas for so long as I tried to find the project that really felt perfect to tackle next, and I’m so excited that I finally landed on the perfect one. While I’m not quite ready to say goodbye to these characters, I’m also very excited for the next thing I’ll get to one day share with you 💜

Shout out to my friends who had to put up with listening to my dozens of different story ideas over the months. We finally got there 😌

August deserves its own month as I stroll down this year’s memory lane.

It feels like so much of my year is a lead up to a book launch. I definitely was better this year about life being more than just work, but I think this will forever remain true. It’s something you spend a year working on, and finally it’s out! Time to celebrate!

Foxglove was my favorite book release yet. I was nervous because no one had read it yet since we didn’t do arcs, but that also made me equally as excited because everyone was getting to find out what happened next at the same time. I’d never gotten to do a tour for a second book in a series, and it was SO much fun because people know the characters! They’re excited and we get to talk about them!! Minus getting horribly sick and having to quarantine both before and after tour, August was fantastic and I’m super glad that I was at least healthy during launch week 😩

Pictured:
1. One of my favorite events ever on tour at An Unlikely Story with the wonderful @amandafoody and @cl_herman 
2. Signing your pre orders at Mysterious Galaxy. We broke a record!
3. Celebrating @timesnewrachel’s release of Bring me Your Midnight!
4. On tour at McNally Jackson in NYC with two incredible talents, @thechloegong and @alexaster 
5. Visiting the Hachette office and getting to meet most of the publishing team and the PFLM agency!
6. With my wonderful friend Haley! The book is dedicated to her 😌
7. Tour stop at Changing Hands! This was the first store I ever went to an event at back when Twilight was new and not yet a phenomenon. A very full circle moment!
8. Lovely readers at the Seattle Masquerade tour stop!
9. My magnificent agent Peter Knapp, and my very first editor back from the ATSAT series, Nicole Otto 🥰
10. (Part of) The Arizona crew

There are so many more pictures I could share, but overall it was an excellent month that ended in crying in the airport as I got the news about being a #1 NYT bestseller 🤣 thank you to everyone who was a part of this month

Happy Friday! I’ve just finished my developmental edits for Wisteria (I’m going to read through the end once more after the holidays just to be sure…) and it’s time to get festive! I’m hosting 23 people for Christmas this year and have got a lot of cleaning and prep work to do!

But first I wanted to share this gorgeous artwork of Signa, illustrated by @emilia.mildner. It’s absolutely gorgeous, and the artist is super talented. They have a ton of bookish art on their page, and I highly recommend you check it out!

I wish you all the best holiday break and can’t wait to see everyone’s recipes! 💜
